result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Mangold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.03(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.

records.addlTxt:
Summarily.

IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on October 31, 2018. that: IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of this circuit court are summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Vicki Zick is relieved of further representation of Mangold in these matters.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court are summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Vicki Zick is relieved of further representation of Mangold in these matters.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary dispostition order will not be published.
IT IS ORDERED that these appeals are consolidated for purposes of disposition. IT IS ORDERED that appeal Nos. 2018AP360-CRNM, 2018AP362-CRNM, and 2018AP363-CRNM be decided by a three-judge panel.

records.addlTxt: Amended Temporary Commitment
BOND QUASHED

1:37 pm  Defendant Christopher L Mangold in court, in custody with attorney Sarah Schmeiser for Tracey A. Wood.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both sides have reviewed PSI.  Court has reviewed PSI, alternate PSI and character letters.
ADA Herrmann indicates his office did not receive alternate PSI and requests Court not consider it.
1:46 pm  Court takes brief recess to allow ADA Herrmann to review alternate PSI which was e-filed.

1:57 pm  Back on the record.
Neither side has any new corrections to make to PSI.
State has complied with victim notification requirement.
Sentencing argument and recommendation by ADA Herrmann.
Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Schmeiser.
2:22 pm Defendant addresses Court.
2:27 pm  Court takes brief recess before pronouncing sentence.

2:39 pm  Back on the record.
Court is ready to proceed to sentencing and goes through SM-34 factors.
Court imposes sentence as follows:

One (1) year in Jail with Huber, imposed and stayed.  Defendant placed on probation for one (1) year.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Pay court costs including supervision fees
Not to possess or consume alcohol

Complete AODA and follow through with any recommendations

Maintain auto insurance on any vehicle he owns or operates
Must have properly installed IID on any vehicle he owns or operates
Must attend Victim Impact Panel
